intro: Lepechiniella albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered lepechiniella, is a small, herbaceous plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants known for their medicinal and ornamental uses. The plant features small, white flowers that bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
